title: Flexbox Layout - Guided Editor (Intermediate)

steps.title: Step 1: Flexbox Basics
steps.content:
Flexbox is a layout system that makes it easy to align and distribute items in a container.

First step: turn on flexbox by setting `display: flex;`

You'll only edit the values marked with **___** - the rest is locked to prevent typos!

task.instruction: Fill in 'flex' for the display property:

steps.title: Step 2: Justify Content
steps.content:
`justify-content` controls horizontal alignment of flex items:
- `flex-start` - align left
- `center` - align center
- `flex-end` - align right
- `space-between` - spread out with space between
- `space-around` - spread out with space around

task.instruction: Center the items horizontally using justify-content:

blanks.hint: Use 'center' to align items in the middle

steps.title: Step 3: Align Items
steps.content:
`align-items` controls vertical alignment:
- `flex-start` - align top
- `center` - align middle
- `flex-end` - align bottom
- `stretch` - stretch to fill height

task.instruction: Center items vertically and add a gap of 20px:

steps.title: Step 4: Flex Direction
steps.content:
`flex-direction` changes the layout direction:
- `row` - horizontal (default)
- `column` - vertical
- `row-reverse` - horizontal reversed
- `column-reverse` - vertical reversed

steps.title: Step 6: Preview Your Work
steps.content:
Excellent! You've mastered Flexbox using guided editing. You learned:
- display: flex
- justify-content (horizontal)
- align-items (vertical)
- flex-direction (layout direction)
- gap (spacing)
